intro: Maihueniopsis neuquensis, commonly known as the Neuquén fern, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Andean regions of Argentina. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that are typically small in size. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its adaptation to extreme conditions, making it an important subject for ecological and evolutionary studies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human disturbance.
